name: OLIO E PI√ô
address: 3 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA

reviews.text:
Suprised at all the good reviews- it‚Äôs a lot of money to pay for extremely overcooked pasta..reminded me of the texture of spaghetti from a can I‚Äôm guessing they cook it in giant batches and scoop it onto your plate for 35 dollars.
It made us both finish in the toilet afterwards. Real Italian food lovers be warmed..
the service is nice and the decor is very cosy though.
The vibe was so chill and the food was very good, thank you!
excellent food and service, alejandro made our espresso martinis and they were the best we've ever had! friendly bar staff and great drinks.
keep an eye out for Alejandro if you want really good drink recommendation!

4/5 ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

A fantastic Italian spot with great vibes

A wonderful place for brunch in New York! We had a really great experience overall.

My wife was personally delighted with the French Toast‚Äîshe said it was one of the best she's ever had: perfectly custardy with a delicious caramelized crust and not overly sweet. Highly recommend it!

I had the Eggs Benedict‚Äîa very high-quality dish. The hollandaise sauce was perfect, and the eggs were poached just right. I'm only giving four stars because, for my personal preference and considering the price point, the portion felt a little light.

Overall, Olio e Pi√π is exactly what you look for in this neighborhood: authentic Italian flair (even during brunch), great wine, a buzzing and lively atmosphere, and excellent service. The only thing to keep in mind is that it's quite expensive, even by NYC standards. But for the quality, service, and prime location, it feels mostly justified.
Delicious homemade pasta and nice atmosphere.
Everything was perfect‚Äîmargaritas, pizza, caesar salad and Branzino were excellent.  Service was amazing!!!!  Will definitely be back!!!
Maria had great recommendations. I really enjoyed the ravioli and her great customer service. Would come back again!
MARIA, is spectacular, she is the best of the best. She knows what she's talking about when it comes to food. She is funny and caring!

I love the place! Let me say Sofia and Payton are the best! Best Italian food! In Spanish: nos dieron un trato espectacular. En medio de mucha gente nos protegieron (Halloween parade)  y la comida es deliciosa! We order all the appetizers and delicious pasta, they were great. Sofia is best! She was so gentle and nice (and  beautiful) Even though it was Halloween Parade and it was full she never forgot we were outside and gave us the best service. BTW, the seven 5 and the martyni expreso! Ufff! The food is awesome and amazing!
Just average Italian food. There are better options in the area.
Great food, but the tables are really packed in.
Un buon ristorante italiano, abbiamo mangiato bene, buon servizio
Todo incre√≠ble , servicio comida la pasta s√∫per fresca

The chicken piccata was a bit overcooked and lacked flavor, which was slightly disappointing. The salmon dish was fine, though not particularly memorable. Service was okay, but could be a bit more attentive. ü•≤

We had such a wonderful experience at Olio e Pi√π! The food was absolutely delicious and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. Our waiter, Gabriel, was incredible‚Äîso friendly, attentive, and made the whole evening extra special. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!
Amazing food starting from appetizers, main course and desserts. You feel like you are in Italy when you're eating their food

I returned here after about 10 years and the restaurant is still good. However, this place used to be THE place to eat a good carbonara in my memories. Well, don't believe what's written in the menu: for sure what I had in my Carbonara wasn't guanciale. It tasted like something bland like pancetta or prociutto.
Everything is very good
Exquisito lugar para comer, muy concurrido en una zona agradable

My husband Carl and I frequent this restaurant whenever we visit NYC.  It is one of our favorite restaurants and the food and atmosphere are exceptional.  But what we loved most from our recent  last visit in late October was our waiter, Lorena, and her wonderful energy, attention, love, and humor.  She created a one of a kind experience for us, which we will forever be grateful for.  I can‚Äôt wait to come back to our favorite NYC restaurant, and you can be sure we will request Lorena!
Came for dinner with friends tonight. Enjoyed the atmosphere. A plus was that our waiter Gabriel was great and very attentive.
The only thing better than the food and ambiance of Olio E Piu was Gabriel‚Äôs service and warm charisma. 10/10 would come back again!!!
The best Italian food I‚Äôve had in NYC. Gabriel was rhe perfect compliment to the food. The carbonara was topped with an egg, and when mixed in, tasted very well. 9.3/10, genuine rating. Come here
The food was phenomenal here. The service even better! Our server Gabriel was outstanding and made sure we had an amazing night.
Maria was great! Food was so yummy:)
Amazing food and great atmosphere! Maria was the best!
The best!!!! Gaberiel is the BEST! My fav place!!!!!!
Gabriel is the best. Ask for Gabriel he treated us so well and I love this restaurant is the best ever!!! I love olio e piu <333
Gabriel was the BEST. The ambience, the food, the interior, was absolutely stunning. My first time here and I will be coming back. 5/5!!!!
The location is convenient, but the food is standard.
Great lunch! Especially the service from our waiter Ceasar. He was so friendly and talkative. Food was great, ambiance even greater

We came to Olio e Pi√π for the first time tonight and we will definitely be back! Maria was our server and she was so professional and kind; helped to pick us the best choices for our tastes. We were debating what wine to get and she was so helpful to make sure that our table gets what we‚Äôre looking for. The food was authentic and so full of flavour; I got the carbonara and the beef carpaccio to start and everything was truly amazing ! Thank you üôèüèªüòä.
Beautiful experience and dinner overall. Maria our server took very good care of us - highly recommend. Great choice for authentic italian cuisine!
Good food and excellent service
Good service and delicious food
Delicious food, good service
Excellent service and good food! Thank you
Olio e Pi√π is a New York City MUST. Marija is a phenomenal server, so kind and attentive!!! The food and drinks are delicious and the atmosphere makes this the perfect dinner spot!
The Bacocolto Spritz and the orecchiette were fantastic!! Marija is such a hospitable server. Highly recommend!
All of the staff was attentive and quick to respond! Our server Marija was so thoughtful and made sure we were comfortable every step of the way!

Wonderful staff, very attentive. We worried we were not going to sit since it was almost 9 but they got us in right away!! Carbonara pasta with the egg on top was delicious. Also their margarita pizza is amazing. Will come back!!

10/10 The food is incredible full stop get the carbonara and be prepared for some good fast food. You would think with how busy it is it‚Äôs slow absolutely not the service is fast polite and excellent. Atmosphere is an absolute vibe lighting art bar couldn‚Äôt ask for more no notes if your in the area or if your not go out of your way and haul over to this John cause it couldn‚Äôt be better no notes just go.
Amazing fast service with amazing good. Got multiple dishes and each one was amazing. Would come again!
Incredible carbonara and an amazing non alcoholic prosecco lychee cocktail
Gabriel is great!!!!! Service is awesome and food is great!
GABRIEL WAS AMAZING!!!! Great service! Great food!
Don‚Äôt skip this place. Worth the hype. Ask for Maria, she was my girl the whole time.  Amazing work experience.
Wonderful experience from start to finish. Ask for Maria. Can‚Äôt wait to comeback.
Absolutely love the atmosphere here ‚Äî delicious food, great service, and they even have alcohol-free prosecco. Had such a great time!‚Äù

Authentic Italian Dining at Olio e Pi√π New York

Mitten im Greenwich Village haben wir im Olio e Pi√π eines der besten italienischen Restaurants in New York erlebt. Das Ambiente ist lebendig, voller Energie und erinnert sofort an kleine Trattorien in Italien. Die Speisekarte bietet alles, was man sich von authentischer italienischer K√ºche w√ºnscht: frische Pasta, knusprige Pizza aus dem Steinofen, cremige Risotti und eine gro√üe Auswahl an italienischen Weinen.

Wir bestellten Burrata als Vorspeise, Tagliatelle mit Tr√ºffel und eine klassische Pizza Margherita. Jedes Gericht war perfekt zubereitet, aromatisch und mit viel Liebe zum Detail serviert. Besonders die Pasta war ein echtes Highlight ‚Äì hausgemacht, al dente und mit einem intensiven Geschmack, wie man ihn sonst nur in Rom oder Florenz findet.

Das Personal war herzlich und professionell, was den Abend noch sch√∂ner gemacht hat. Als Dessert rundete ein Tiramisu in bester italienischer Tradition das Erlebnis ab.

Mein Tipp: Am besten rechtzeitig reservieren, da Olio e Pi√π zu den beliebtesten Restaurants im Village geh√∂rt. Wer drau√üen sitzt, genie√üt zus√§tzlich das besondere Flair des Viertels und erlebt New York von seiner sch√∂nsten Seite.

F√ºr alle, die italienisches Essen lieben, ist Olio e Pi√π ein echtes Must-Visit in Manhattan ‚Äì ein kulinarisches St√ºck Italien im Herzen der Stadt.

An unexpected spectacular dinner. We came in with no reservation and we were able to get a table at the bar. We had the most delicious pasta entrees, but because we saw the steak being prepared we had to order a second entree. It was perfection and the staff were friendly and helpful in recommending the best option for our appetites.

The food was fantastic! We got the carbornara pasta and it was the best we've had in the city and our server Gabrielle was great! For our appetizer we had the caponatina eggplant and it was absolutely delicious. The service was extremely attentive and so warming. I would definitely come back here again! Thank you! ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è

Era da un po‚Äô di tempo che desideravo provare ‚ÄúOlio e Pi√π‚Äù, ristorante italiano nel Greenwich Village. Ci sono stato per un brunch domenicale. Voglio partire dalle note positive. Personale di sala molto attento e disponibile. All‚Äôarrivo l‚Äôattesa per accomodarsi, premetto che avevo prenotato, e per ordinare √® stata quasi nulla nonostante l‚Äôelevata affluenza. Apprezzato l‚Äôomaggio di pane, olio e olive. Passando alle note negative, ho purtroppo sperimentato un vero e proprio disastro culinario. Non so se ci√≤ si attribuibile a errori in cucina, mi auguro per loro, o a scelte di men√π da rivedere totalmente. Per iniziare ho preso delle uova alla Benedict (Uovo Benedetto che da men√π dovrebbe essere composto da focaccia bread, fonduta, bacon e naturalmente uova in camicia). Non saprei nemmeno come descrivere ci√≤ che mi √® stato servito. Cominciando dal pane, due fettine dure come la pietra che non erano di certo il focaccia bread elencato nel men√π. Bacon carbonizzato, fonduta praticamente non pervenuta (a parte delle minuscole gocce quasi per caso presenti sul pane mentre ci si aspetterebbe che la fonduta fosse in quantit√† tale da ricoprire le uova) e uova oltre modo cotte (vedi foto). Ho voluto comunque provare anche il loro French Toast per verificare se le uova alla Benedict fossero state per caso un piccolo incidente di percorso. Anche in questo caso delusione. Porzione minuscola (una fetta di pane) tale da non giustificare il prezzo. Guarnizione di frutti di bosco striminzita e sciroppo d‚Äôacero quasi non pervenuto come la fonduta. Mi spiace dovere dare un giudizio negativo ma l‚Äôesperienza non √® stata all‚Äôaltezza delle mie aspettative basate sulle recensioni che avevo letto. Spero di potermi ricredere e cambiare opinione nel caso tornassi da Olio e Pi√π.
